kind.description: specifies the version kind such as semver, regex, or latest

pattern.description: specifies the version pattern according the version kind

strict.description: strict enforce strict versioning rule. Only used for semantic versioning at this time

versionfilter.description:
versionfilter provides parameters to specify the version pattern used when generating manifest.

		kind - semver
			versionfilter of kind `semver` uses semantic versioning as version filtering
			pattern accepts one of:
				`patch` - patch only update patch version
				`minor` - minor only update minor version
				`major` - major only update major versions
				`a version constraint` such as `>= 1.0.0`

		kind - regex
			versionfilter of kind `regex` uses regular expression as version filtering
			pattern accepts a valid regular expression

		example:
		```
			versionfilter:
				kind: semver
				pattern: minor
		```

		and its type like regex, semver, or just latest.

spec.description: ActionSpec specifies the configuration of an action of type "GitHub Pull Request"

url.description: "url" defines the Gitea url to interact with

username.description: "username" defines the username used to authenticate with Gitea API

token.description: "token" specifies the credential used to authenticate with Gitea API

sourcebranch.description:
"sourcebranch" defines the branch name used as a source to create the Gitea pullrequest.

		default:
			"sourcebranch" inherits the value from the scm branch if a scm of kind "gitea" is specified by the action.

		remark:
			unless you know what you are doing, you shouldn't set this value and rely on the scmid to provide the sane default.

targetbranch.description:
"targetbranch" defines the branch name used as a target to create the Gitea pullrequest.

		default:
			"targetbranch" inherits the value from the scm working branch if a scm of kind "gitea" is specified by the action.

		remark:
			unless you know what you are doing, you shouldn't set this value and rely on the scmid to provide the sane default.
			the Gitea scm will create and use a working branch such as updatecli_xxxx

owner.description:
"owner" defines the Gitea repository owner.

		remark:
			unless you know what you are doing, you shouldn't set this value and rely on the scmid to provide the sane default.

repository.description:
"repository" defines the Gitea repository for a specific owner

		remark:
			unless you know what you are doing, you shouldn't set this value and rely on the scmid to provide the sane default.

title.description:
"title" defines the Gitea pullrequest title

		default:
			A Gitea pullrequest title is defined by one of the following location (first match)
				1. title is defined by the spec such as:

					actions:
						default:
							kind: gitea/pullrequest
							scmid: default
							spec:
								title: This is my awesome title

				2. title is defined by the action such as:

					actions:
						default:
							kind: gitea/pullrequest
							scmid default
							title: This is my awesome title

				3. title is defined by the first associated target title

				4. title is defined by the pipeline title

		remark:
			usually we prefer to go with option 2

body.description:
"body" defines a custom body pullrequest.

		default:
			By default a pullrequest body is generated out of a pipeline execution.

		remark:
			Unless you know what you are doing, you shouldn't set this value and rely on the sane default.
			"body" is useful to provide additional information when reviewing pullrequest, such as changelog url.

file.description:
"file" defines the yaml file path to interact with.

		compatible:
			* source
			* condition
			* target

		remark:
			* "file" and "files" are mutually exclusive
			* when used as a source or condition, the file path also accept the following protocols
			* protocols "https://", "http://", and "file://" are supported in path for source and condition

files.description:
"files" defines the list of yaml files path to interact with.

		compatible:
			* condition
			* target

		remark:
			* file and files are mutually exclusive
			* protocols "https://", "http://", and "file://" are supported in file path for source and condition

key.description:
"key" defines the yaml keypath.

		compatible:
			* source
			* condition
			* target

		remark:
			* key is a simpler version of yamlpath accepts keys.

		example:
			* key: $.name
			* key: $.agent.name
			* key: $.agents[0].name
			* key: $.agents[*].name
			* key: $.'agents.name'

		remark:
			field path with key/value is not supported at the moment.
			some help would be useful on https://github.com/goccy/go-yaml/issues/290

value.description:
"value" is the value associated with a yaml key.

		compatible:
			* source
			* condition
			* target

		default:
			When used from a condition or a target, the default value is set to linked source output.

keyonly.description:
"keyonly" allows to only check if a key exist and do not return an error otherwise

		compatible:
			* condition

		default:
			false

command.description: command specifies the shell command to execute by Updatecli

name.description: Name defines the environment variable name

value.description: Value defines the environment variable value

items.description: Environment is a struct containing information for an environment variable such as its name and its value

environments.description: environments allows to pass environment variable(s) to the shell script. By default no environment variable are shared.

files.description: Files specifies the list of file that Updatecli monitors to identify state change

warning.description: Warning defines the command exit code used by Updatecli to identify a change need. Default to 2 if no exitcode have been specified

success.description: Success defines the command exit code used by Updatecli to identify no changes are needed. Default to 0 if no exitcode have been specified

failure.description: Failure defines the command exit code used by Updatecli to identify that something went wrong. Default to 1 if no exitcode have been specified

changedif.description: ChangedIf defines how to interpreted shell command success criteria. What a success means, what an error means, and what a warning would mean

shell.description: Shell specifies which shell interpreter to use. Default to powershell(Windows) and "/bin/sh" (Darwin/Linux)

workdir.description: workdir specifies the working directory path from where to execute the command. It defaults to the current context path (scm or current shell). Updatecli join the current path and the one specified in parameter if the parameter one contains a relative path.

file.description:
"file" defines the yaml file path to interact with.

		compatible:
			* source
			* condition
			* target

		remark:
			* "file" and "files" are mutually exclusive
			* when used as a source or condition, the file path also accept the following protocols
			* protocols "https://", "http://", and "file://" are supported in path for source and condition

files.description:
"files" defines the list of yaml files path to interact with.

		compatible:
			* condition
			* target

		remark:
			* file and files are mutually exclusive
			* protocols "https://", "http://", and "file://" are supported in file path for source and condition

key.description:
"key" defines the yaml keypath.

		compatible:
			* source
			* condition
			* target

		remark:
			* key is a simpler version of yamlpath accepts keys.

		example:
			* key: $.name
			* key: $.agent.name
			* key: $.agents[0].name
			* key: $.agents[*].name
			* key: $.'agents.name'

		remark:
			field path with key/value is not supported at the moment.
			some help would be useful on https://github.com/goccy/go-yaml/issues/290

value.description:
"value" is the value associated with a yaml key.

		compatible:
			* source
			* condition
			* target

		default:
			When used from a condition or a target, the default value is set to linked source output.

keyonly.description:
"keyonly" allows to only check if a key exist and do not return an error otherwise

		compatible:
			* condition

		default:
			false

file.description:
"file" defines the yaml file path to interact with.

		compatible:
			* source
			* condition
			* target

		remark:
			* "file" and "files" are mutually exclusive
			* when used as a source or condition, the file path also accept the following protocols
			* protocols "https://", "http://", and "file://" are supported in path for source and condition

files.description:
"files" defines the list of yaml files path to interact with.

		compatible:
			* condition
			* target

		remark:
			* file and files are mutually exclusive
			* protocols "https://", "http://", and "file://" are supported in file path for source and condition

key.description:
"key" defines the yaml keypath.

		compatible:
			* source
			* condition
			* target

		remark:
			* key is a simpler version of yamlpath accepts keys.

		example:
			* key: $.name
			* key: $.agent.name
			* key: $.agents[0].name
			* key: $.agents[*].name
			* key: $.'agents.name'

		remark:
			field path with key/value is not supported at the moment.
			some help would be useful on https://github.com/goccy/go-yaml/issues/290

value.description:
"value" is the value associated with a yaml key.

		compatible:
			* source
			* condition
			* target

		default:
			When used from a condition or a target, the default value is set to linked source output.

keyonly.description:
"keyonly" allows to only check if a key exist and do not return an error otherwise

		compatible:
			* condition

		default:
			false

trimsuffix.description: TrimSuffix removes the suffix from the transformer input value

from.description: From defines the source value which need to be replaced

to.description: To defines the "to what" a "from" value needs to be replaced

items.description: Replacer is struct used to feed strings.Replacer

replacers.description: Replacers specifies a list of replacer instruction

from.description: From defines the source value which need to be replaced

to.description: To defines the "to what" a "from" value needs to be replaced

replacer.description: Replacer specifies what value needs to be changed and how

find.description: Find searches for a specific value if it exists and return false if it doesn't

pattern.description: Pattern defines regular expression to use for retrieving a submatch

captureindex.description: CaptureIndex defines which substring occurrence to retrieve. Note also that a value of `0` for `captureIndex` returns all submatches, and individual submatch indexes start at `1`.

findsubmatch.description: Find searches for a specific value if it exists then return the value using regular expression

semverinc.description: SemvVerInc specifies a  comma separated list semantic versioning component that needs to be upgraded.

items.description: Transformer holds a transformer rule

transformers.description: transformers defines how the default input value need to be transformed

url.description: "url" defines the Gitea url to interact with

username.description: "username" defines the username used to authenticate with Gitea API

token.description: "token" specifies the credential used to authenticate with Gitea API

repository.description: [S][C][T] repository specifies the name of a repository for a specific owner

kind.description: specifies the version kind such as semver, regex, or latest

pattern.description: specifies the version pattern according the version kind

strict.description: strict enforce strict versioning rule. Only used for semantic versioning at this time

versionfilter.description: [S] versionfilter provides parameters to specify version pattern and its type like regex, semver, or just latest.

title.description: [T] title defines the Gitea release title.

tag.description: [C][T] tag defines the Gitea release tag.

commitish.description: [T] commitish defines the commit-ish such as `main`

description.description: [T] description defines if the new release description

draft.description: [T] draft defines if the release is a draft release

prerelease.description: [T] prerelease defines if the release is a pre-release release

spec.description: Spec defines settings used to interact with Gitea release

scmid.description: scmid specifies the scm configuration key associated to the current resource

targets.description: Targets defines the list of target configuration

version.description: Version specifies the minimum updatecli version compatible with the manifest
